title: Trump faces peril in docs probe after decades of scrutiny
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — As a businessman and president, Donald Trump faced a litany of lawsuits and criminal investigations yet emerged from the legal scrutiny time and again with his public and political standing largely intact.

title: Arizona certifies 2022 election despite GOP complaints
shortDescription: PHOENIX (AP) — Arizona's top officials certified the midterm election results Monday, formalizing victories for Democrats over Republicans who falsely claimed the 2020 election was rigged.

title: Warnock, Walker: Starkly different choices for Black voters
shortDescription: ATLANTA (AP) — Raphael Warnock is the first Black U.S. senator from Georgia, having broken the color barrier for one of the original 13 states with a special election victory in January 2021, almost 245 years after the nation’s founding.

title: What to watch in Tuesday’s Georgia Senate runoff election
shortDescription: ATLANTA (AP) — The extended Senate campaign in Georgia gives Democratic Sen. Raphael Warnock and Republican challenger Herschel Walker a second chance to persuade voters to send them to Washington.

title: Ex-Miami congressman Rivera arrested in Venezuela probe
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — A former Miami congressman who signed a $50 million consulting contract with Venezuela’s socialist government has been arrested in connection to an ongoing federal criminal investigation, law enforcement officials said.

title: EXPLAINER: Congress is acting on gay, interracial marriage
shortDescription: CHICAGO (AP) — Legislation that ensures same-sex and interracial marriages are recognized as legal unions appears headed for final approval and President Joe Biden's signature, a bipartisan agreement that reflects a wider acceptance of gay rights in both Congress and the country.

title: Supreme Court weighs ‘most important case’ on democracy
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Supreme Court is about to confront a new elections case, a Republican-led challenge asking the justices for a novel ruling that could significantly increase the power of state lawmakers over elections for Congress and the presidency.

title: Blinken vows US support for Israel despite unease over gov’t
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Sunday the U.S. will not shrink from its unwavering support for Israel despite stark differences with Prime Minister-elect Benjamin Netanyahu and concerns the Biden administration may have about potential members of his incoming right-wing government.

title: Trump rebuked for call to suspend Constitution over election
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — Former President Donald Trump faced rebuke Sunday from officials in both parties after calling for the “termination” of parts of the Constitution over his lie that the 2020 election was stolen.

title: In Georgia, how sports explain a political battleground
shortDescription: SMYRNA, Ga. (AP) — The reception area of a metro Atlanta office suite is a veritable museum of Herschel Walker’s football success for the University of Georgia Bulldogs and the NFL. The office is part of the Atlanta Braves' real estate development in the Major League Baseball franchise's new suburban home.

title: Longtime Arizona GOP Rep. Jim Kolbe dies at 80
shortDescription: PHOENIX (AP) — Jim Kolbe, a Republican congressman who represented a heavily Democratic region of Arizona for more than two decades and was a proponent of gay rights, has died. He was 80.

title: Turkish strikes on US Kurd allies resonate in Ukraine war
shortDescription: BUCHAREST, Romania (AP) — Biden administration officials are toughening their language toward NATO ally Turkey as they try to talk Turkish President Recep Erdogan out of launching a bloody and destabilizing ground offensive against American-allied Kurdish forces in neighboring Syria.

title: Non-religious voters wield clout, tilt heavily Democratic
shortDescription: When members of the small Pennsylvania chapter of Secular Democrats of America log on for their monthly meetings, they're not there for a virtual happy hour.“We don’t sit around at our meetings patting ourselves on the back for not believing in God together,” said David Brown, a founder from the Philadelphia suburb of Ardmore.

title: Defeated election conspiracists seek to lead Michigan GOP
shortDescription: LANSING, Mich. (AP) — The Republicans who lost their races for Michigan's top three statewide offices after promoting falsehoods about the 2020 presidential election are not planning to go quietly.

title: GOP’s Duarte takes California Central Valley US House seat
shortDescription: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Republican John Duarte defeated Democrat Adam Gray on Friday in a new California U.S. House district in the Central Valley farm belt that produced the closest congressional contest in the state this year.

title: To boost Georgia’s Warnock, Biden goes to ... Massachusetts
shortDescription: BOSTON (AP) — President Joe Biden hit the phones with fellow Democrats Friday for Georgia Sen. Raphael Warnock's runoff election. He fetched hot coffee for volunteers, too, and thanked them for their work.

title: Dems move to make South Carolina, not Iowa, 1st voting state
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — Democrats voted Friday to remove Iowa as the leadoff state on the presidential nominating calendar and replace it with South Carolina starting in 2024, a dramatic shakeup championed by President Joe Biden to better reflect the party’s deeply diverse electorate.

title: Prosecutor: Evidence shows Trump ‘explicitly’ OK’d tax fraud
shortDescription: NEW YORK (AP) — In the end, it wasn't a last-minute smoking gun but a prosecutor insisting that evidence shows Donald Trump was aware of a scheme that his Trump Organization’s executives hatched to avoid paying personal income taxes on millions of dollars worth of company-paid perks.

title: Distaste for Walker provides tailwind for Warnock in Georgia
shortDescription: MORROW, Ga. (AP) — It might go without saying that Democrats generally vote against Republicans. But in Georgia’s U.S.

title: Biden sees economy avoiding recession, but risks remain
US targets Russian mercenary group over religious freedom
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Biden administration on Friday placed a well-known Russian paramilitary organization on a list of religious freedom violators alongside a number of notorious terrorist organizations.

title: Boebert’s race against Frisch in Colorado goes to recount
shortDescription: DENVER (AP) — The Colorado Secretary of State has ordered a recount in the congressional race where Republican Rep. Lauren Boebert led Democrat Adam Frisch by just 550 votes in an unexpectedly tight race.

title: Georgia: What to expect on election night
shortDescription: A fiercely competitive Senate runoff in Georgia has national implications as Democrats try to solidify their hold on the upper chamber of Congress. Democratic Sen. Raphael Warnock is trying to win a full Senate term against Republican challenger Herschel Walker.

title: AP sources: Biden tells Dems he wants SC as 1st primary vote
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden has declared that Democrats should give up “restrictive” caucuses and prioritize diversity at the start of their presidential primary calendar — dealing a major blow to Iowa's decadeslong status as the state that leads off the process.

title: Arizona county certifies election after judge’s order
shortDescription: PHOENIX (AP) — A rural Arizona county certified its midterm election results on Thursday, following the orders of a judge who ruled that Republican supervisors broke the law when they refused to sign off on the vote count by this week's deadline.

title: Obama urges Georgia Democrats to push turnout for Warnock
shortDescription: ATLANTA (AP) — Former President Barack Obama and Sen. Raphael Warnock on Thursday urged Democratic voters to keep pushing an apparent head start in early voting in the Georgia Senate runoff against Republican Herschel Walker, ahead of Friday's last day of early in-person voting and Tuesday's election day.

title: Bidens entertain more than 330 guests at 1st state dinner
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — The first White House state dinner of President Joe Biden's administration drew big names Thursday from fashion, entertainment, politics and business who turned out to help celebrate French President Emmanuel Macron and the return of large social events after the pandemic.

title: EU edges closer to $60-per-barrel Russian oil price cap
shortDescription: BRUSSELS (AP) — The European Union was edging closer to setting a $60-per-barrel price cap on Russian oil — a highly anticipated and complex political and economic maneuver designed to keep Russia's supplies flowing into global markets while clamping down on President Vladimir Putin's ability to fund his war in Ukraine.

title: New US sanctions against North Koreans over missile program
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Biden administration on Thursday imposed sanctions on three members of North Korea’s ruling party's central committee for their involvement in the country’s ballistic missile program.

title: High court to rule on Biden student loan cancellation plan
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Supreme Court agreed Thursday to decide whether the Biden administration can broadly cancel student loans, keeping the program blocked for now but signaling a final answer by early summer.

title: Can Dems build on their Senate majority? Georgia runoff will decide.
shortDescription: Incumbent Sen. Raphael Warnock and GOP challenger Herschel Walker are once again in a tight race ahead of Georgia's runoff Senate election.

title: Paul Pelosi makes first public appearance since being attacked
shortDescription: Paul Pelosi, the husband of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, made his first public appearance this week since he was attacked in the couple’s home.

title: Former Rep. Jim Kolbe, 11-term member of Congress, dead at 80
shortDescription: Jim Kolbe, remembered as a "political powerhouse," was a GOP member of the House of Representatives from 1985 until 2007.

title: GOP leaders mostly silent on Trump call to suspend Constitution
shortDescription: As party leaders remained silent, a few Republicans on Sunday did reject Trump's extraordinary suggestion for "termination" of the U.S. Constitution.

title: Twitter docs released by Elon Musk show debate over Hunter Biden laptop
shortDescription: Twitter honored requests from both the Biden campaign and Trump White House to remove tweets they flagged, journalist Matt Taibbi said.

title: Brian Kemp in 2024? The GA governor who outperformed Trump gets a look.
shortDescription: Gov. Brian Kemp's star is rising in GOP politics thanks to his easy reelection win and his ability to survive a barrage of attacks from Donald Trump.

title: Does the Democrats’ new presidential calendar invite chaos in 2023?
shortDescription: Both Iowa and New Hampshire have vowed to follow their state laws and hold their presidential nominating processes first, risking punishment.

title: Inside Biden's surprise rollout of a new Democratic primary lineup
shortDescription: Ahead of a black-tie dinner, President Biden surprised Democrats with his call to put South Carolina first in the primary process and elevate Georgia.

title: If Kevin McCarthy loses, could Dems and GOP moderates pick House speaker?
shortDescription: Some moderate House Republicans have left the door open to working with Democrats to choose a speaker if Kevin McCarthy can't rally enough votes.

title: Democrats' new presidential primary calendar set, with major shifts in order
shortDescription: Democrats voted to make history by emphasizing and elevating Black voices in the early days of the presidential nominating process.

title: Prosecutor says evidence shows Trump OK'd alleged tax fraud at two firms
shortDescription: A defense attorney representing one of the Trump companies on trial for the alleged fraud dismissed the argument raised in the prosecution's closing.

title: DeSantis, Florida dump BlackRock and 'woke' ESG investing
shortDescription: Florida is yanking $2 billion worth of state assets managed by BlackRock, escalating the GOP standoff with the world’s largest money manager over ESG.

title: South Carolina first to vote in presidential primary
shortDescription: South Carolina will now be the first state to vote in presidential primaries with Democrats knocking Iowa out of its long-held spot.

title: White House: Putin has not shown willingness to talk and end Ukraine war
shortDescription: White House spokesman John Kirby said Moscow's actions speak louder than than the Kremlin's conditional interest in discussing ending the war in Ukraine.

title: Iowa, New Hampshire Democrats vow to rebel to keep first-in-the-nation status
shortDescription: Unhappy Iowa and New Hampshire Democrats are threatening to defy the DNC if it bumps them from the top of the presidential nominating process.

title: Freight rail strike averted; Biden signs legislation keeping system open
shortDescription: The agreement includes a 24% pay increase over five years and $5,000 bonuses but only one paid sick day off. Unions wanted six additional days.

title: One million Georgians vote early in runoff
shortDescription: More than 1 million voters cast their ballots early in the Georgia runoff between Sen. Raphael Warnock and Republican Hershel Walker.

title: St. Louis Can Banish People From Entire Neighborhoods. Police Can Arrest Them if They Come Back.
shortDescription: Neighborhood orders of protection in St. Louis are intended to fight petty crime and nuisances but they raise constitutional questions.

title: What’s Really at Stake in a Politically Charged Supreme Court Case on Elections
shortDescription: Moore v. Harper could transform the law — but not in the way that many pundits, or even politicians, anticipate.

title: At Washington State Special Education Schools, Years of Abuse Complaints and Lack of Academics
shortDescription: Northwest SOIL promised to help students with serious disabilities. But when school districts urged action, the state let the private school stay open and receive millions in tax dollars.

title: Georgia Voters Brace for Long Lines and Wet Weather
shortDescription: Officials in Fulton County acknowledged that there could be significant wait times at election precincts, which they said will be fully staffed.By Neil Vigdor

title: Everything Democrats Could Do if Warnock Wins
shortDescription: Once more, America’s fate is bound up in Georgia. By Ross Barkan

title: The Man Who Neutered Trump
shortDescription: Brian Kemp is having a moment.By Michelle Cottle

title: In Georgia, a Heated Senate Race Stirs Mixed Emotions in Black Voters
shortDescription: The contest might have been a showcase of Black political power in the Deep South. But many Black voters say Herschel Walker’s turbulent campaign has marred the moment.By Maya King, Clyde McGrady and Jazmine Ulloa

title: Congressional Freshmen’s First Fight: Landing a Good Office
shortDescription: Representatives-elect cheered and sneered as they drew buttons in a lottery that would decide the order in which they could choose their new offices on Capitol Hill.By Stephanie Lai
